page.title: 16EVENTS IN SHALBOURNE - 1985
page.content: In bitter winter weather, a{car boot {sale}was held on the Sports Field. In the spring the{Parent Teachers Assn organised an excellent{May Fair}on the village green to raise money for a car park for the school. A local{art show was held in the Kingston Room in aid of the local Play Group and Helen House, Oxford, a terminal cancer home for children. Many Bring-and-Buys were held in aid of charities or local interests. The cricket team ran two matches against a ladies' team in the summer. The village hall was used for a dinner celebrating the Diamond Jubi- lee of{Shalbourne + Ham WI}and for the annual{Harvest Supper.}The Wiltshire Village Hall Competition, when the condition of the building and its amenities were inspected, recently took place. At Great Bedwyn sports ground, annual{dog races}are held.
